intro: Medinilla merguiensis, commonly known as the Mergui medinilla, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically features glossy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in various shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
